Enjoy Safe Streets 阻止抢劫
享受安全街（底特律警察机关计划）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均可表示"强调"之意。
means: emphasis ： 指尽力突出的重要性或重点。
stress ： 常可与emphasis换用，但侧重指迫不及待地强调或坚持。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"压力，重压，紧张"之意。
means: strain ： 指某人为克服外力界压力而造成的身心和情绪等方面的压抑。用于物时，指任何力或合力作用于一个物体上面造成的应变。
stress ： 侧重指承受外来的压力，也指由于某种原因而引起的心理、生理或情绪上的紧张。
pressure ： 在科学上，指单位面积上所受到的压力。用于引申时，指某事物所产生的压力或影响力等。
tension ： 多指因关系不好或其它原因而出现的紧张状态，也指某物被过度伸展的程度或状态。

word_mean: 压迫，压力：强有力地施加影响，在牙科学上，指咀嚼时上牙对下牙的压力
应激反应，紧张状态，应力：对内部或外界的、身体或精神或情绪上的任何有害刺激的生物学反应之总称，可使机体的内环境稳定受到破坏，假如这些补偿反应不足的或不适当，就可导致病变。此术语亦用来指造成这种应激反应。另见syndrome项下的general adaptation syndrome
受力物体截面上内力的集度，即单位面积上的内力。
条件不利于生物生长、繁殖的环境。

sentence.Network_en: Massage is used to relax muscles, relieve stress and improve the circulation.
sentence.Network_cn: 按摩可以使肌肉放松，缓解压力和促进血液循环。

sentence.Network_en: Stress is widely perceived as contributing to coronary heart disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 压力被广泛认为是导致冠心病的一个因素。

sentence.Network_en: Stress, both human and mechanical, may also be a contributing factor.
sentence.Network_cn: 来自人的和机械方面的压力可能也是一个因素。

jx.jx_en_mean: To subject to or undergo extreme stress, as from working.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 极度受压：经历如来自于工作的极端压力

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting hardship or force exerted on a person for the purpose of compulsion): shortening of distress, or partly from Old French estresse 'narrowness, oppression', based on Latin strictus 'drawn tight' (see strict)

entry.def: If you stress a point in a discussion, you put extra emphasis on it because you think it is important.

example.ex: The spokesman stressed that the measures did not amount to an overall ban...
example.tran: 该发言人强调这些措施并不等同于全面禁止。

example.ex: They also stress the need for improved employment opportunities, better transport and health care...
example.tran: 他们同时也强调需要增加就业机会，改善交通和医疗保健服务。

entry.tran: 精神压力;心理负担;紧张
entry.def: If you feel under stress, you feel worried and tense because of difficulties in your life.

example.ex: Katy could think clearly when not under stress...
example.tran: 在没有精神压力的情况下凯蒂思路清晰。

example.ex: Of course, the British will suffer such daily stresses patiently.
example.tran: 当然，英国人将会耐心地承受这些日常压力。

entry.def: Stresses are strong physical pressures applied to an object.

example.ex: Earthquakes happen when stresses in rock are suddenly released as the rocks fracture.
example.tran: 当岩石碎裂时其承受的压力突然释放出来，地震就发生了。

entry.def: If you stress a word or part of a word when you say it, you put emphasis on it so that it sounds slightly louder.

example.ex: 'Sit down,' she replied, stressing each word.

means.word_mean: 1. the relative prominence of a syllable or musical note (especially with regard to stress or pitch);

sentences.sentence: "he put the stress on the wrong syllable"

means.word_mean: 2. (psychology) a state of mental or emotional strain or suspense;

sentences.sentence: "he suffered from fatigue and emotional tension"

means.word_mean: 3. (physics) force that produces strain on a physical body;

sentences.sentence: "the intensity of stress is expressed in units of force divided by units of area"
"the stress was more on accuracy than on speed"

means.word_mean: 5. difficulty that causes worry or emotional tension;

sentences.sentence: "she endured the stresses and strains of life"
"he presided over the economy during the period of the greatest stress and danger"- R.J.Samuelson

means.word_mean: 1. to stress, single out as important;

sentences.sentence: "Dr. Jones emphasizes exercise in addition to a change in diet"

means.word_mean: 2. put stress on; utter with an accent;

sentences.sentence: "In Farsi, you accent the last syllable of each word"

auth_sentence.content: It was just enough additional stress to trigger it.

Sentence.sentence: To stress the importance of energy conservation.

Annan stressed the need for the negotiations to focus on increasing the flow of money from rich to poor regions to help reduce their vulnerability to climate hazards while still curbing the emissions of the heat-trapping gases.
To avoid being overwhelmed by stress
It stresses competition rather than cooperation.

sentences.en: The roof couldn't bear the stress of the snow.
sentences.cn: 屋顶受不了积雪的压力。

sentences.en: Some students are completely struck down by the stresses of examinations.
sentences.cn: 有些学生被考试的压力完全压垮了。

sentences.en: My parents lay great stress on honesty.
sentences.cn: 我的父母十分注重诚实。

sentences.en: The stress is on the last syllable.
sentences.cn: 重音在最后一个音节上。

sentences.en: That article stressed the same problem.
sentences.cn: 那篇文章强调了同一个问题。

sentences.en: He stressed that we should always be honest.
sentences.cn: 他强调我们应该永远诚实。

means.word_mean: 给…加压力(或应力)；使紧张

sentences.en: He was being stressed before he gave his lecture.
sentences.cn: 演讲前的那一阵子他感到十分紧张。
